snippet: All of Europe’s bad news may be adding up to some long-term opportunities for stock investors, one asset manager says. But, he adds, it doesn’t look like a place for quick profits.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column cites Litman Gregory Asset Management investment manager Jeremy DeGroot, who believes the European financial crisis may be offering some long-term opportunities for stock investors; warns, however, that he does not think it looks like a place for quick profits.
lead_paragraph: All of Europe’s bad news may be adding up to some long-term opportunities for stock investors, one asset manager says. But, he adds, it doesn’t look like a place for quick profits.

headline.print_headline: When All Looks Bleak, Maybe It’s Time to Invest
headline.seo: Why European Stocks May Be Ripe for Long-Term Gains
headline.main: A Contrarian Case for Investing in Europe
